Detailed Description

An animation listener receives notifications from an animation.

Notifications indicate animation related events, such as the end or the repetition of the animation.

 // need to implement all interface.
 class myAnimatorListener : public IAnimatorListener {
 public:
  void onAnimationStart(Animator* animation){}
  void onAnimationEnd(Animator* animation){}
  void onAnimationCancel(Animator* animation){}
  void onAnimationRepeat(Animator* animation)
  {
      animation->start();
  }
 };

 myAnimatorListener *listener = myAnimatorListener();
 ObjectAnimator *animator = ObjectAnimator::ofFloatN(myObject, "x", 2, 0.0f, 100.0f);
 animator->setDuration(500);
 animator->addListener(listener);

 delete listener;
 delete animator;
See also:
AnimatorListenerAdapter if you don't want to implement all interface, you can try to use AnimatorListenerAdapter.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::core::IAnimatorListener::onAnimationCancel ( Animator *  animation) [pure virtual]

Notifies the cancellation of the animation.

This callback is not invoked for animations with repeat count set to INFINITE.

Parameters:
animationThe animation which was canceled.

Implemented in gaia::core::AnimatorListenerAdapter.

virtual void gaia::core::IAnimatorListener::onAnimationEnd ( Animator *  animation) [pure virtual]

Notifies the end of the animation.

This callback is not invoked for animations with repeat count set to INFINITE.

Parameters:
animationThe animation which reached its end.

Implemented in gaia::core::AnimatorListenerAdapter.
